recipes.title: Pasta Primavera
instructions: Cook pasta according to packet instructions.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add courgette and bell pepper, cook for 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes.
Drain pasta and toss with vegetables.
Season with salt and pepper, top with parmesan and basil.

recipes.title: Quick Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice chicken into thin strips.
Cut broccoli into florets and slice carrots.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes until cooked through.
Remove chicken and set aside.
Add vegetables to the wok and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Return chicken to the wok, add soy sauce.
Toss everything together and serve with sesame seeds and spring onions.

recipes.title: Classic Cheese Omelette
instructions: Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour in egg mixture and let it set slightly.
Use a spatula to gently push cooked edges towards centre.
When mostly set but still slightly runny on top, add cheese.
Fold omelette in half and slide onto plate.
Garnish with chives and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Homemade Tomato Soup
instructions: Roughly chop tomatoes and onion.
Heat olive oil in a large pan, add onion and garlic.
Cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes.
Pour in stock and bring to a boil.
Simmer for 20 minutes.
Blend until smooth.
Stir in cream if using, season to taste.
Serve with fresh basil.

recipes.title: Classic Fish and Chips
instructions: Cut potatoes into thick chips and soak in cold water for 30 minutes.
Drain and pat dry thoroughly.
Heat oil to 140°C and blanch chips for 5 minutes. Remove and drain.
Mix flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Whisk in beer.
Heat oil to 180°C.
Dip fish in batter and carefully lower into hot oil.
Fry for 6-8 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Increase oil temperature and fry chips again until golden.
Drain on kitchen paper and serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Vegetable Curry
instructions: Dice potatoes and cut cauliflower into florets.
Fry onion and garlic until softened.
Add curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and coconut milk, bring to simmer.
Add potatoes and cauliflower.
Simmer for 25-30 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in spinach until wilted.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice or naan.

recipes.title: Beef Tacos
instructions: Fry onion and garlic until softened.
Add minced beef and cook until browned.
Add cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Cook for 10 minutes, adding a splash of water if dry.
Warm taco shells according to packet instructions.
Shred lettuce and dice tomatoes.
Fill taco shells with beef mixture.
Top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and sour cream.

recipes.title: Fluffy Banana Pancakes
instructions: Mash bananas in a bowl.
Add eggs and milk, whisk together.
Sift in flour and baking powder, mix until just combined.
Heat a little butter in a non-stick pan.
Pour small amounts of batter to make pancakes.
Cook until bubbles appear, then flip.
Cook for another minute until golden.
Serve stacked with maple syrup and blueberries.

recipes.title: Classic Greek Salad
instructions: Cut cucumber and tomatoes into chunks.
Thinly slice red onion.
Combine vegetables in a large bowl.
Add olives and crumble feta on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Toss gently and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Shepherd's Pie
instructions: Peel and chop potatoes, boil until tender.
Mash with butter and milk, season well.
Fry onion and carrots until softened.
Add lamb mince and brown well.
Stir in tomato puree and stock.
Add Worcestershire sauce and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add peas and transfer to a baking dish.
Top with mashed potato, creating peaks with a fork.
Bake at 200°C for 25-30 minutes until golden.

recipes.title: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
instructions: Keep stock warm in a separate pan.
Fry mushrooms in butter until golden, set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add rice and toast for 2 minutes.
Pour in wine and stir until absorbed.
Add stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
Continue until rice is creamy and al dente (about 18 minutes).
Stir in mushrooms, remaining butter, and parmesan.
Season and serve with extra parmesan.

recipes.title: Salmon Teriyaki
instructions: Mix soy sauce, honey, minced garlic, and grated ginger.
Add rice wine vinegar and sesame oil if using.
Place salmon in a dish and pour over half the marinade.
Leave for 15-30 minutes.
Heat a pan and cook salmon skin-side down for 4 minutes.
Flip and cook for 3 more minutes.
Pour remaining sauce into pan and let it glaze the salmon.
Serve with sliced spring onions and rice.
